page.title: 20Local Footpaths
page.content: but when we lived in Enfield it was not a very good place for walking. When we moved to Ugley we were really surprised to see so many fields. We moved in on August 9th so the fields had just been ploughed, when we talked to our neighbours, we asked about the footpaths and they said there was meant to be one going across our field but the farmer would not leave it so we didn't know where it was exactly. The Council said they would give my dad a map of the footpaths but we never heard anything from them. My dad said "I'm going to walk across the footpath with my dogs and if Mr Recay decides to shoot them or fine me that's when something's going to be done about it". Footpaths are a right of way and unless they are used we could all lose access to the countryside".
